hypothesis_content.title: Bull-to-Stress Transition via Parabolic Advance & Volume Climax
hypothesis_content.statement: In a BULL regime, if BTC rallies >40% in 14 days on declining 14-day RSI (bearish divergence) and the rally culminates in a single-day volume spike >150% of its 30-day average, a subsequent daily close below the 10-day SMA will trigger a transition to a STRESS regime within 3 days with 70% probability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Parabolic moves on diverging momentum and climax volume represent speculative exhaustion. The break of a key short-term moving average after such a signal confirms the failure of the bullish trend's momentum, often precipitating a sharp, high-volatility correction (STRESS).
entry_conditions: 14-day RSI is lower than its reading 7 days prior (divergence)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Regime transitions to STRESS (confirmed by model)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price reclaims and holds above 10-day SMA for 2 consecutive days

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If fewer than 60% of such signals result in a STRESS regime classification OR the average 5-day return after the signal is > -2%.
